#Text=Keep Your Apartment Warm
#Text=Winter can get pretty cold .

#Text=While we put on a cheerful face by playing hockey and having snowball fights , at the end of the day , we ’re all dependent on our furnaces and heating systems to get us through those dark , cold months .
#Text=However , winter is only as cold as you want it to be –
#Text=with a few easy-to-implement winter apartment heating tips , you ’ll be able to keep warm and toasty when the temperature drops below the freezing mark .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Close Your Windows – And Keep Them Closed
#Text=The biggest single source of radiant heat loss in your apartment is most likely your windows ( especially if they are old , single-pane windows ) .
#Text=It may seem like an obvious tip , but check all of the windows in your apartment to make sure they are closed and locked during the winter .
#Text=As well , try to avoid opening the windows at all , if possible .
#Text=Even if you keep your windows closed , however , warm air can still escape : * Between the window frame and the wall ; * Around the edges of a loose pane or through cracks in the glass .
#Text=To prevent warm air from escaping through the window frame , you can install durable metal or plastic weather-stripping between the window sash and frame .
#Text=Typically , these types of weather-stripping will last for several years and do not interfere with the regular use of the window .
#Text=Cover Any “ Leaky ” Windows To prevent air from escaping around the edges of a loose pane , caulk or tape around the edge of the loose pane where it meets the framework of the sash .
#Text=Alternatively , you can cover “ leaky ” windows with a thin sheet of plastic to try to keep the warm air in and the cool air out .
#Text=These simple “ window kits ” can make a big difference in reducing any drafts throughout your apartment .
#Text=Always get permission from your landlord before installing anything or modifying your apartment windows .
#Text=Your landlord might even pay for and make the installations for you , depending on the situation .

#Text=Draft-Proof Your Doors Just like your windows , keeping your apartment door closed as much as possible during the winter will help keep the heat where it belongs – in your apartment instead of in the hallway .
#Text=You can also draft-proof your doors with weather-stripping and caulking .
#Text=Warm air can easily escape between the door frame and the wall – if this is the case in your apartment , caulk between the frame and the wall .
#Text=In most apartments , the vast majority of warm air is lost under the bottom of the door .
#Text=Installing a door sweep or a draft-stopper to prevent air from moving under the door can prevent this loss and keep your apartment warm .
#Text=These supplies can be found inexpensively at any hardware store .
#Text=In addition to keeping your apartment comfortable , weatherproofing your doors and windows will also save a lot of energy as you wo n’t be using as much heat to keep your apartment warm .
#Text=Do n’t Block Your Radiators
#Text=Finally , if your apartment has radiators , they should always be kept clean – any amount of dirt and dust sitting on top of them will absorb some of the heat that is being produced .
#Text=You should also remove any radiator covers when the heat is on , as covers can block the airflow through the radiator in addition to absorbing heat .
#Text=Be sure to also move your furniture so that all chairs , couches , bookcases , entertainment units , desks , beds , etc. are n’t too close to your radiators or heating convectors .

#Text=Do n’t let your drapes or curtains cover them either , as they will divert heat to the windows ( and therefore out of your apartment if they are n’t properly sealed ) instead of into the rest of the room .
#Text=Tips

#Text=While you ca n’t avoid the cold entirely , following these easy tips should keep you a little bit warmer this winter and give you a nice , cozy apartment to come home to after a fun snowball fight or game of hockey outside with your friends .
#Text=Keep yourself warm by not going in and out
#Text=plan your trips so you keep your habitat warmer and cooler year round .
#Text=Use a smoke pen or a stick of incense to make a plume of smoke and look for leaks around windows and switch and outlet plates .
#Text=Insulation and weather stripping helps contain heat and keep the temperature consistent , but it does n't create heat .
#Text=You will still need a working heat source to keep warm .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Always get permission from your landlord before installing anything or modifying your apartment windows or doors .
#Text=You may use blankets to keep some of the cold drafts out as well .
